video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM_seg1.mp4
question: Why should I clean the windshield wiper ?

video_name: Improve Your Windshield Wiper Performance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-esaKAXXG0KM
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.277 --> 00:00:06.654
Did you know that dirty glass or wiper
blades are one of the major reasons for
00:00:06.654 --> 00:00:09.020
streaks and
smears on your windshield when wiping?
00:00:10.170 --> 00:00:12.640
If this happens,
lift your wiper blades up and
  
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:16.680
clean the entire windshield glass,
as well as the rubber blades.
00:00:16.680 --> 00:00:19.270
Be sure to clean the windshield
using a neutral detergent
00:00:19.270 --> 00:00:23.030
such as Motorcraft Premium
Windshield Washer Concentrate or
00:00:23.030 --> 00:00:26.960
Motorcraft Ultra-Clear Spray
Glass Cleaner, and a soft cloth.
00:00:26.960 --> 00:00:28.090
Then rinse with clear water.
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.405
In extreme cases,
you may need to use a mild abrasive,
00:00:32.405 --> 00:00:36.480
non-chlorinated cleaner, and
wash the wiper blades using a sponge or
00:00:36.480 --> 00:00:40.860
soft cloth and rubbing alcohol, or
Premium Windshield Washer Fluid.
00:00:40.860 --> 00:00:45.060
If your wipers continue to smear your
windshield, you may need to replace them.
00:00:45.060 --> 00:00:45.920
Any questions?
00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.075
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:48.075 --> 00:00:58.075

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:18.590 --> 00:00:23.540
When you shift into reverse, the camera
automatically shows you a 360-degree
00:00:23.540 --> 00:00:25.480
view on the right side of the screen,
00:00:25.480 --> 00:00:28.090
as well as a rear view on
the left side of the screen.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg2.mp4
question: Does the vehicle have more than one camera feature?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:28.090 --> 00:00:30.200
When looking at the 360-degree view,
00:00:30.200 --> 00:00:33.180
you'll see dotted yellow lines
on each side of the vehicle.
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:36.690
These represent the keep-out zone and
let you know where the edges of your
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:40.290
mirror are in relation to what
you're seeing in the camera image.

video_trans:
00:00:46.420 --> 00:00:50.420
There's also a small white car icon in the
upper left corner of your touch screen.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.680
It lets you know which camera view is
being used, for example, 360 view,
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:56.840
split view, etc..
00:00:56.848 --> 00:01:00.550
The icon highlights will change when
you switch from one view to another.

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:08.050 --> 00:01:11.350
Here, you'll also see the park distance
control alert in the upper right corner.
00:01:12.360 --> 00:01:15.120
Press it again for
a split view of what's behind you.
00:01:15.120 --> 00:01:19.190
Split view will allow you to see cross
traffic or cars coming from either side
00:01:19.190 --> 00:01:22.218
and that can be helpful when you're
backing out of a parking space.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg7.mp4
question: How is parking made easy?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:22.218 --> 00:01:25.740
When you shift into drive,
you'll have to push the camera button for
00:01:25.740 --> 00:01:28.690
front view as it doesn't
automatically come on.
00:01:28.690 --> 00:01:31.900
When you do, it will show
a full screen with a 360-degree
00:01:31.900 --> 00:01:36.170
image on the right side of the screen and
a normal front view on the left side.
00:01:36.170 --> 00:01:40.620
Press it again for a normal front view and
once again for a front-split view.

question: What angles do the camera show?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:28.090 --> 00:00:30.200
When looking at the 360-degree view,
00:00:30.200 --> 00:00:33.180
you'll see dotted yellow lines
on each side of the vehicle.
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:36.690
These represent the keep-out zone and
let you know where the edges of your
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:40.290
mirror are in relation to what
you're seeing in the camera image.

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:08.050 --> 00:01:11.350
Here, you'll also see the park distance
control alert in the upper right corner.
00:01:12.360 --> 00:01:15.120
Press it again for
a split view of what's behind you.
00:01:15.120 --> 00:01:19.190
Split view will allow you to see cross
traffic or cars coming from either side
00:01:19.190 --> 00:01:22.218
and that can be helpful when you're
backing out of a parking space.

a split view of what's behind you.
00:01:15.120 --> 00:01:19.190
Split view will allow you to see cross
traffic or cars coming from either side
00:01:19.190 --> 00:01:22.218
and that can be helpful when you're
backing out of a parking space.

question: Does split view offer safer reversing?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:22.218 --> 00:01:25.740
When you shift into drive,
you'll have to push the camera button for
00:01:25.740 --> 00:01:28.690
front view as it doesn't
automatically come on.
00:01:28.690 --> 00:01:31.900
When you do, it will show
a full screen with a 360-degree
00:01:31.900 --> 00:01:36.170
image on the right side of the screen and
a normal front view on the left side.
00:01:36.170 --> 00:01:40.620
Press it again for a normal front view and
once again for a front-split view.

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.

below for safety purposes.

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg3.mp4

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs_seg3.mp4

video_name: Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Folding Seats with Side Release and Folding Head Restraints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nTO2w5-8rIA_seg1.mp4

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.

00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: What temperatures will help my engine with optimum functioning?

outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: Does auto start/stop turn the engine off at every stop?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or

to recharge the battery.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg1.mp4
question: What is the function of the Auto Start-Stop feature?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: What does the auto start-stop function do?

00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: How do you know when start/stop is activated?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:48.710 --> 00:00:51.282
Here are a few things you should know.
00:00:51.282 --> 00:00:55.670
Auto Start Stop will not shut
your engine off at every stop if
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:59.510
the engine is still warming up,
if the outside temperature is too hot or
00:00:59.510 --> 00:01:03.710
too cold, or if the heat and
air conditioning is in high use.
00:01:03.710 --> 00:01:08.750
So if your AC's on because it's hot
outside, your engine may keep running.
00:01:08.750 --> 00:01:12.490
It may also restart while stopped
to maintain interior comfort or
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:14.420
to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg3.mp4
question: Does auto stop shut off my engine at every stop?

to recharge the battery.
00:01:14.420 --> 00:01:17.680
Also, if you're towing a trailer or
using the four high or
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:21.290
four low feature of the four-wheel
drive system, the start/stop feature
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.180
automatically shuts off and will turn on
again once you disable those features.
00:01:26.260 --> 00:01:29.590
You can also use the five-way switch
located on your steering wheel
00:01:29.590 --> 00:01:33.540
to get to the information on demand screen
which tells you if your engine is off or
00:01:33.540 --> 00:01:34.350
why it's still running.
00:01:35.510 --> 00:01:39.130
And one more thing, your vehicle is
equipped with a heavy duty starter and
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:42.268
battery to compensate for
the increased number of starts and stops.

question: Does the increased number of starts and stops affect my starter or battery?

question: Does this vehicle offer features that make towing easier?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:10.810 --> 00:00:14.600
For starters, your vehicle has
a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454
stiffness and
durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection
status along with lighting and
00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510
trailer battery alerts, and warnings.

the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.

in the eight-inch productivity screen.

00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:44.950 --> 00:00:48.607
In addition, your rear-view camera has
an enhancement that shows you an image of
00:00:48.607 --> 00:00:50.453
what's directly behind your vehicle.
00:00:50.453 --> 00:00:52.361
It's called Dynamic Hitch Assist and
00:00:52.361 --> 00:00:56.541
it has guidelines that can help you line up
your trailer when you're connecting it.
00:00:56.541 --> 00:01:00.271
The image appears in your center display
to help you maneuver when you're in
00:01:00.271 --> 00:01:04.710
reverse and to help you accurately
connect to your trailer without help.

the other trailering technology.

brake controller synchronizes your truck

brakes with the electric brakes
on your trailer for smoother and
00:01:14.820 --> 00:01:15.840
more effective braking.

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg8.mp4
question: What is the use of trailer sway control system?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.

question: What features make this truck easier to connect to trailers?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:10.810 --> 00:00:14.600
For starters, your vehicle has
a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454
stiffness and
durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection
status along with lighting and
00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510
trailer battery alerts, and warnings.

question: What are the pieces of information that you can retrieve?

video_trans:
00:00:44.950 --> 00:00:48.607
In addition, your rear-view camera has
an enhancement that shows you an image of
00:00:48.607 --> 00:00:50.453
what's directly behind your vehicle.
00:00:50.453 --> 00:00:52.361
It's called Dynamic Hitch Assist and
00:00:52.361 --> 00:00:56.541
it has guidelines that can help you line up
your trailer when you're connecting it.
00:00:56.541 --> 00:01:00.271
The image appears in your center display
to help you maneuver when you're in
00:01:00.271 --> 00:01:04.710
reverse and to help you accurately
connect to your trailer without help.

located on your gear shift lever.
00:01:30.699 --> 00:01:34.500
You'll know what's on when you see it
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg7.mp4
question: What does the button labelled 'T/S' stand for?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:34.500 --> 00:01:38.570
Trailer sway control works in conjunction
with the roll stability control system
00:01:38.570 --> 00:01:42.170
to determine if your trailer is swaying
and gradually applies your brakes.
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:44.110
And if necessary,
reduces your engine power.
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:47.780
Trailer tow mirrors are also
available to help improve
00:01:47.780 --> 00:01:49.850
rear visibility when
towing large trailers.

video_name: Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.036
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.036 --> 00:00:08.658
There are a few convenient ways to gain
access to the rear luggage compartment in
00:00:08.658 --> 00:00:09.600
your vehicle.
00:00:09.600 --> 00:00:11.210
Let me explain.
00:00:11.210 --> 00:00:14.360
From the driver's seat, simply push
the trunk release button on the lower left
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.520
side of the instrument panel next to the
steering column to unlatch the rear deck lid.
00:00:18.520 --> 00:00:20.230
With the standard Intelligent Access,
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:24.120
you can get into your vehicle remotely
without reaching for your key fob.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:25.320
With your key fob on you,
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:29.350
just press the trunk release button
located above the license plate here.
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:32.071
It's that simple.
00:00:32.071 --> 00:00:33.095
Any questions?
00:00:33.095 --> 00:00:34.727
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:34.727 --> 00:00:44.727
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Rear Decklid Release _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Fjh0-VKzUEk_seg1.mp4
question: How do I release the rear decklid?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:15.750 --> 00:00:19.831
To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141
press and hold the unlock button on
your key fob for at least three seconds.
00:00:24.141 --> 00:00:27.449
If you want to stop them from opening,
just press the lock or
00:00:27.449 --> 00:00:28.738
unlock button again.
00:00:28.738 --> 00:00:30.999
[MUSIC]

question: how many time needs the unlock?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

To open all of your windows at once and
vent the moon roof if you have one,
00:00:19.831 --> 00:00:24.141

your key fob for at least three seconds.

unlock button again.

question: How long should you press and hold the lock button?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg3.mp4
question: How do I suddenly stop the windows from closing because my child's fingers are there or something?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: How can we make extra space in the vehicle?

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: where are the seat straps located?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg2.mp4

question: Where is the red strap located?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4

00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: How the seat can be adjusted?

Okay, now I'll quickly discuss

00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460

00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: What is the use of fold and force support panel?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4

question: How to unfold the third row seats?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4

question: What are the uses of long and short straps on the back of folded seat?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4

Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.

Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.

the seat back closest to the door, here.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: How do you fold the second and thrid row seats down?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:00:41.850 --> 00:00:43.340
To fold the third row seats,
00:00:43.340 --> 00:00:47.460
find the strap on the seat cushion
located in the seat-bite, here.
00:00:47.460 --> 00:00:50.298
Pull it and flip the cushions so
that the seat bottom is face down.
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:54.090
Next, locate the red
strap in the seat back.
00:00:54.090 --> 00:00:57.641
It looks like it's tucked into a small
pocket in the lower corner of the seat
00:00:57.641 --> 00:00:58.220
back.
00:00:58.220 --> 00:01:00.980
Pull it, and fold the seat back down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg2.mp4

question: Where is the red strap needed for folding the 3rd row seats located at?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4

00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: Which strap do you pull first to fold the second row seats?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:

Okay, now I'll quickly discuss

00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460

00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980

00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780

00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490

00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910

00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670

00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: What do you have to do first to get to the folding floor support panels?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: Can you move the third row seats forward and backwards?

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: How do you retract the floor panels?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:35.030
Here are a few helpful tips for
unfolding the third row seats.
00:01:35.030 --> 00:01:38.130
You may need to do the next two
steps from the rear of the vehicle.
00:01:38.130 --> 00:01:42.500
First, retract the floor panels by
pulling up on the attached strap.
00:01:42.500 --> 00:01:46.620
Next, grab the third row seat back strap
located behind the head restraint and
00:01:46.620 --> 00:01:47.830
lift it to its locked position.
00:01:49.130 --> 00:01:52.725
Now, go back to the rear side of the door
and use the strap on the front of
00:01:52.725 --> 00:01:55.070
the seat cushion to flip it
back to its original position.
00:01:56.380 --> 00:01:57.950
And here's something you'll appreciate.
00:01:57.950 --> 00:02:02.210
You can also move the third row seats
forward and back and recline them.
00:02:02.210 --> 00:02:04.250
Just lift the metal bar
under the seat cushion and
00:02:04.250 --> 00:02:06.140
slide the seat forward or back.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:09.530
And pull the same strap you used to
fold the seat back down to recline them.
00:02:09.530 --> 00:02:12.160
Only now, just lean back to recline.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg4.mp4
question: where is the third row seat back strap located?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.866
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.866 --> 00:00:08.482
You might be interested to know that
your car can help you parallel park, and
00:00:08.482 --> 00:00:11.390
get you into and
out of a tight parallel parking spot.
00:00:11.390 --> 00:00:15.020
In fact, thanks to available Enhanced
Active Park Assist with side sensing
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.200
system and distance control,
it can also let you know of there are any
00:00:18.200 --> 00:00:21.600
objects in front of, behind or
next to your vehicle.

Let me show you how it works.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
youâ€™ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:54.660 --> 00:00:58.290
Active Park Assist can also help you get
out of a tight parallel parking space,
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:01.080
which is great if someone is parked
too close in front of or behind you.
00:01:02.190 --> 00:01:05.320
Just press the same active park
assist button you used to park.
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:08.410
Let go of the steering wheel then
simply follow the prompts displayed on
00:01:08.410 --> 00:01:09.370
your screen.
00:01:09.370 --> 00:01:12.750
Once again you just accelerate,
shift, and brake as needed.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:34.440
And keep in mind, you can cancel the
parking process at any time by grabbing
00:01:34.440 --> 00:01:37.610
the steering wheel or
pressing the activation button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg5.mp4
question: what does pressing the information button do?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420
and a visual diagram display on your
touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.

Language: en

[MUSIC]
00:00:04.866 --> 00:00:08.482
You might be interested to know that
your car can help you parallel park, and
00:00:08.482 --> 00:00:11.390
get you into and
out of a tight parallel parking spot.
00:00:11.390 --> 00:00:15.020
In fact, thanks to available Enhanced
Active Park Assist with side sensing
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.200
system and distance control,
it can also let you know of there are any
00:00:18.200 --> 00:00:21.600
objects in front of, behind or
next to your vehicle.
00:00:21.600 --> 00:00:22.890
Let me show you how it works.

question: How does Active Park Assis work?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:22.890 --> 00:00:25.210
To activate the park assist feature,
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.670
press the active park assist button
on the center console, here.
00:00:28.670 --> 00:00:31.400
Then signal to indicate which side
you'd like the vehicle to search.
00:00:32.520 --> 00:00:35.450
An information screen will
appear on your center display.
00:00:35.450 --> 00:00:39.120
And the system will begin to scan for
available parking spots.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.160
Once an appropriate spot is found,
youâ€™ll hear a chime and
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:44.910
see a spot found message on your screen.
00:00:44.910 --> 00:00:48.180
Follow the prompts on your screen,
accelerating, shifting and
00:00:48.180 --> 00:00:50.070
braking as needed.
00:00:50.070 --> 00:00:52.180
And be sure to watch your mirrors and
your surroundings for
00:00:52.180 --> 00:00:54.660
any objects which you may
be getting too close to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg2.mp4

question: What will happen when the park assist feature find an appropriate parking spot?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:00:54.660 --> 00:00:58.290
Active Park Assist can also help you get
out of a tight parallel parking space,
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:01.080
which is great if someone is parked
too close in front of or behind you.
00:01:02.190 --> 00:01:05.320
Just press the same active park
assist button you used to park.
00:01:05.320 --> 00:01:08.410
Let go of the steering wheel then
simply follow the prompts displayed on
00:01:08.410 --> 00:01:09.370
your screen.
00:01:09.370 --> 00:01:12.750
Once again you just accelerate,
shift, and brake as needed.

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420
and a visual diagram display on your
touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.

[MUSIC]

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.052
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.052 --> 00:00:09.786
Your vehicle is equipped with an available
wiper stalk that controls the front and
00:00:09.786 --> 00:00:10.770
rear window wipers.
00:00:12.120 --> 00:00:15.140
Your front wipers are controlled
by moving the stalk up or down.
00:00:18.340 --> 00:00:20.720
And the rear wiper controls
are at the tip of the stalk.
00:00:21.770 --> 00:00:22.780
Let me show you how they work.

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:28.690
If you have rain-sensing front wipers,
move the stalk up to the first position.
00:00:28.690 --> 00:00:32.790
You can change their speed or sensitivity
by turning the inner-ring up or down.
00:00:33.920 --> 00:00:35.900
If you don't have
the rain-sensing feature,
00:00:35.900 --> 00:00:38.860
the ring controls the delay between wipes.
00:00:38.860 --> 00:00:40.830

video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970

triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.

To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.

video_trans:
00:00:57.840 --> 00:01:01.330
Okay, now let's take
a look at the rear wipers.
00:01:01.330 --> 00:01:05.880
The switch at the end of the stock allows
you to turn them on and select your speed.
00:01:05.880 --> 00:01:08.010
The first position is for
intermittent wiping.
00:01:10.050 --> 00:01:11.860
The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg1.mp4
question: How do I use the front and rear wiper stalk?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:23.920 --> 00:00:28.690
If you have rain-sensing front wipers,
move the stalk up to the first position.
00:00:28.690 --> 00:00:32.790
You can change their speed or sensitivity
by turning the inner-ring up or down.
00:00:33.920 --> 00:00:35.900
If you don't have
the rain-sensing feature,
00:00:35.900 --> 00:00:38.860
the ring controls the delay between wipes.
00:00:38.860 --> 00:00:40.830
And if you just don't
want to use the feature,
00:00:40.830 --> 00:00:44.400
you can always choose between normal and
fast wipes.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg2.mp4
question: Do I have to use the rain sensing feature?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970
Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?

a look at the rear wipers.

you to turn them on and select your speed.

The first position is for
intermittent wiping.

The second is for a continuous wipe.
00:01:13.570 --> 00:01:16.120
And O is off for the wiper.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.026 --> 00:00:04.444
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.444 --> 00:00:08.061
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that enhances how your vehicle
00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794
responds to steering wheel input by
reacting more smoothly at higher speeds
00:00:11.794 --> 00:00:16.010
and reducing steering wheel rotations
to maneuver at lower speeds.
00:00:16.010 --> 00:00:20.580
Plus, when activated, tow/haul mode delays
up shifts and provides engine braking when
00:00:20.580 --> 00:00:24.510
descending hilly roads while towing
a trailer or hauling heavy loads.

question: What is the use of tow/haul mode?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:00.295 --> 00:01:03.545
If you plan on towing a trailer or
boat for example, you'll need to
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390
activate the tow/haul feature by pressing
the button on the gear shift lever, here.
00:01:08.390 --> 00:01:11.540
The Tow Haul indicator will
illuminate in the instrument cluster,
00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg4.mp4
question: When will the truck react slower to driver input at higher speeds?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.026 --> 00:00:04.444
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.444 --> 00:00:08.061
Your vehicle may be equipped with
a feature that enhances how your vehicle
00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794
responds to steering wheel input by
reacting more smoothly at higher speeds
00:00:11.794 --> 00:00:16.010
and reducing steering wheel rotations
to maneuver at lower speeds.
00:00:16.010 --> 00:00:20.580
Plus, when activated, tow/haul mode delays
up shifts and provides engine braking when
00:00:20.580 --> 00:00:24.510
descending hilly roads while towing
a trailer or hauling heavy loads.

question: What is the main added feature?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4

00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.

question: When is adaptive steering most useful?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:00.295 --> 00:01:03.545
If you plan on towing a trailer or
boat for example, you'll need to
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390
activate the tow/haul feature by pressing
the button on the gear shift lever, here.
00:01:08.390 --> 00:01:11.540
The Tow Haul indicator will
illuminate in the instrument cluster,
00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.

00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg3.mp4
question: What will illuminate in the instrument cluster when Tow/Haul Mode is activated?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:17.518 --> 00:01:21.390
While in tow/haul mode, the truck
will react slower to driver input
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:26.130
at higher speeds, which allow both truck
and trailer to follow your intended path,
00:01:26.130 --> 00:01:30.580
while also maintaining the ease of parking
and performing low speed maneuvers.
00:01:30.580 --> 00:01:34.490
When starting or turning off your vehicle,
you might hear a faint click sound,
00:01:34.490 --> 00:01:36.670
this is just part of
the system's initialization and
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.270
shutdown process,
don't worry, this is normal.

things to help with the setup.
00:00:20.540 --> 00:00:25.230

measurement card, a tape measure, a pen or
00:00:25.230 --> 00:00:29.490
pencil, an assistant to help out if needed
as well as the checkered sticker that
00:00:29.490 --> 00:00:32.110
comes with your guide which
I'll tell you about later.

video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg2.mp4
question: What will you need to begin?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: What type of trailer is compatible with pro trailer backup assist?

00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: How does pro trailer backup assist work ?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4

question: How much increment can be kept to round off numbers?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:03:07.000 --> 00:03:09.700
Now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the system's
00:03:09.700 --> 00:03:10.640
information display.
00:03:11.720 --> 00:03:15.190
To input the measurements you recorded
outside the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg6.mp4
question: How measurements are inputted into system's information display?

00:03:15.190 --> 00:03:18.540
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:21.130
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed.
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.444
Like this,
then OK to confirm each measurement and
00:03:24.444 --> 00:03:26.769
to move on to the next measurement.
00:03:26.769 --> 00:03:28.618
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:03:28.618 --> 00:03:31.761
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:03:31.761 --> 00:03:35.591
If correct, select Confirm and hit OK.
00:03:35.591 --> 00:03:39.573
Once you've confirmed the measurements,
the system will automatically search for
00:03:39.573 --> 00:03:42.172
the sticker target and
highlight it with a red circle and
00:03:42.172 --> 00:03:44.391
the message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:03:44.391 --> 00:03:47.495
If it is, select yes to confirm.
00:03:47.495 --> 00:03:50.762
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know setup is complete and
00:03:50.762 --> 00:03:51.927
measurements are saved.
00:03:51.927 --> 00:03:54.753
If you don't see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:03:54.753 --> 00:03:57.201
Make sure the measurements are correct and
that the trailer and
00:03:57.201 --> 00:03:59.115
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:03:59.115 --> 00:04:03.779
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straightforward between 4 and 25 miles per
00:04:03.779 --> 00:04:07.844
hour as directed until you get a message
confirming calibration is complete.
00:04:07.844 --> 00:04:08.911
Any questions?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the Pro Trailer Backup Assistance button located?
